originalTitle: Flights to northern Ethiopia cancelled as fears mount of renewed conflict
title: Planes Take a Little Break in Northern Ethiopia!
content:
Hello, Amazing African Kids!

Hi everyone! Your friendly news reporter from Africa is here! Today, I want to share some news about planes in a beautiful country in our amazing continent called Ethiopia. Sometimes, news can sound a bit big and grown-up, but I’m here to make it super simple for you. We always talk about important things, and we always remember to be kind and hopeful!

Planes Are Taking a Little Break

Imagine you have a big toy airplane, and you want it to fly, fly, fly! But sometimes, your grown-up might say, "Not right now, sweetie. It's not safe to fly it inside the house!" Well, something a little bit like that is happening in a part of Ethiopia called 'northern Ethiopia'. Big, real planes that carry people and goods through the sky are not flying there right now. They've decided to take a little break.

What Does "Cancelled" Mean?

Did you hear the grown-ups say "flights are cancelled"? Don't worry, it's not a scary word! "Cancelled" just means that a plane trip that was planned won't be happening today or for a little while. It's like when your school trip to the park gets cancelled because it starts raining very hard. The grown-ups in charge send a message, like a text message on a phone, to tell everyone. This message said the flights were cancelled because of "unforeseen circumstances." That's just a grown-up way of saying "things we didn't expect to happen" or "reasons we can't control right now."

Where is Northern Ethiopia?

Ethiopia is a wonderful country, right here in Africa! It’s famous for many amazing things, like delicious coffee, ancient churches carved into rocks, and a very long, interesting history. Northern Ethiopia is just one part of this big, beautiful country. Imagine Ethiopia is like a big, lovely house. Northern Ethiopia is like one of the special rooms in that house. It's full of kind people and amazing places. **Did you know?** Ethiopia is one of the oldest countries in the world, and it's where coffee was first discovered! Maybe your parents enjoy a cup of coffee because of Ethiopia!

Why Are Grown-ups Worried?

Now, this is the part where grown-ups are being extra careful. Sometimes, in some places, people don't always agree, and things can get a bit noisy or tricky. When grown-ups are worried that people might not be super safe in a certain area, they make important decisions. They want to protect everyone, especially children like you. So, because some grown-ups are worried about things being a bit tricky in northern Ethiopia, they've decided that it's best for the big planes to not fly there for a little while. It's all about making sure that everyone who travels by plane, and everyone who lives near the airport, is as safe as possible.

It's All About Safety First!

Think about it: for a plane to fly, everything needs to be calm and clear, both in the sky and on the ground. Pilots are super-trained heroes! Their most important job is to keep everyone on the plane safe. So, if they think there's even a tiny chance of things not being perfectly safe, they would rather not fly. It’s a very responsible thing to do. This decision to stop flights is a way to say, "Let's wait until everything is calm and safe again, so no one has to worry." It's like your teacher telling you not to run with scissors – it’s just to keep you safe and happy! **Did you know?** Airplanes are one of the safest ways to travel because pilots and airport workers follow very strict rules to keep everyone out of harm's way!

What Happens When Flights Stop?

When planes stop flying to a place, it can mean that people who wanted to visit their family can't go right now. Or people who needed to send important packages might have to wait. It can make things a bit difficult for grown-ups. But everyone understands that safety comes first, even if it means waiting a bit longer to see loved ones or send things. Grown-ups who work for the airlines, and many other grown-ups, are always thinking about how to help people travel safely. They know it's important for friends and families to be together.

Working Towards a Peaceful Sky

The good news is that many grown-ups in Ethiopia and in other countries are talking to each other. They are working very hard to make sure that everyone in northern Ethiopia can live peacefully and happily together again. They want to make sure the skies above Ethiopia are happy and calm, ready for planes to fly. It takes time, just like it takes time to clean up your room after a big play session, but everyone is trying their best to bring peace and quiet back to the area. We all hope that soon, the tricky times will pass, and sunshine and smiles will fill the air. **Did you know?** Africa is a continent of many, many languages and cultures, and people often work together, talking and listening, to solve big problems!

A Bright Future Ahead!

We believe that soon, the worries will go away, and the planes will be able to fly to northern Ethiopia again. When that happens, people can travel to see their grandmas, their uncles, or go to school. They can have fun adventures and explore all the beautiful places. Just like after a big rainstorm, the sun always comes out, we hope for bright and peaceful days for all our friends in Ethiopia. We send them all our love and hope for a safe and happy future. Your friendly African reporter, wishing you clear skies and happy hearts! **Did you know?** The continent of Africa is home to amazing animals like lions, elephants, and giraffes, and it has incredible natural wonders like the Sahara Desert and Mount Kilimanjaro!
summary: Planes are not flying to northern Ethiopia right now because grown-ups are worried about safety, but everyone hopes for peace and for flights to return soon.
whyMatters: This is important because it shows how grown-ups always put safety first, even if it means stopping planes, and many people are working hard so that everyone in Ethiopia can live safely and happily again.

originalTitle: Melania Trump documentary not showing in South African cinemas
title: Melania Trump documentary not showing in South African cinemas
content: No reason has been given but the decision follows a huge fall-out between South Africa and the US.

originalTitle: 'The water took everything': Mozambique hit by worst floods in decades
title: Big Water in Mozambique: Helping Our Friends!
content:
Hello everyone! It's your friend here, reporting to you live from beautiful Africa! I have some news to share with you today about a country not too far from me called Mozambique. It's a special place with lots of sunshine, lovely beaches, and friendly people. But something big and a bit sad happened there recently, and I want to tell you all about it in a way that helps us understand and feel together.

What is a Flood?

Sometimes, when it rains, it rains a little bit. And sometimes, it rains a lot, like when someone leaves the garden hose on for days! When too much rain falls, especially for many days in a row, the rivers get super, super full. They get so full that the water jumps out of its bed and goes everywhere! This is called a flood. It's like a giant puddle that covers everything, even places where water shouldn't be. Did you know? Rain is super important for plants and animals to grow, and for us to have water to drink! But too much rain can be a problem.

Mozambique: A Special Place

Mozambique is a wonderful country on the east side of Africa. It has long, sunny coasts by the big blue ocean. Imagine building sandcastles there! There are also lots of green places and animals. Many families live in small villages and towns, and kids love to play outside, just like you!

Too Much Rain!

For many, many weeks, it rained and rained and rained in Mozambique. It was not just a little drizzle; it was like the sky cried big, heavy tears without stopping. This happened because of something called "heavy rains," which means much, much more rain than usual. It was more rain than they had seen in a very, very long time.

Water, Water Everywhere!

Because of all this rain, the rivers grew huge and angry. The water spilled out and rushed into homes, schools, and playgrounds. It was like a giant, unstoppable river flowing through towns and villages. People had to leave their houses very quickly to find safe places. Imagine water coming right into your living room!

Lost Toys and Homes

Nearly 700,000 people were affected by this big water. That's like all the children and grown-ups from many, many schools put together! For many children, their homes were filled with water, or even washed away. This means they lost their beds, their clothes, and even their favourite toys. It's very sad to lose your special things. Did you know? "Affected" means that something bad happened to them because of the floods. It made their lives difficult and sad for a while.

Why Clean Water is Super Important

When floods happen, the clean water that people usually drink can get mixed with dirty water. This can make people very sick. So, finding clean water to drink and wash with becomes very, very important. Helpers bring big bottles of clean water to keep everyone healthy.

Brave Helpers!

Even when things looked very difficult, there were so many brave helpers! People in boats went to rescue families stuck on their rooftops. Neighbours helped neighbours. Big helpers from different countries also came to lend a hand. They brought food, blankets, and tents for people who lost their homes.

Finding Safe Places

Families had to move to safe places, like big schools or community centres on higher ground. These places became new, temporary homes where people could sleep, eat, and feel safe from the water. It’s hard to leave your home, but it’s important to be safe.

Building Back Stronger

The floods took many things away, but they could not take away the hope and strength of the people of Mozambique. Everyone is working together to clean up, rebuild, and help each other. It will take time, but with kindness and help, they will make their homes and towns strong again. Did you know? Sometimes, after a big flood, the ground can become super fertile, which means it's great for growing food! Nature has amazing ways of bouncing back.

How Can We Help?

We might be far away, but we can still help our friends in Mozambique! We can send them kind thoughts and wishes. We can learn more about their beautiful country. And we can remember to always be kind and helpful to the people around us, because helping each other makes the whole world a better place.

Let's Think of Our Friends

So, remember our friends in Mozambique. They faced a really big challenge with lots of water. But they are also showing how brave and strong they are. Let’s hope for sunshine and happy days for all of them as they rebuild their lives. Your friend from Africa says bye for now!
summary: Huge floods in Mozambique caused by too much rain have affected nearly 700,000 people, but brave helpers are working to rebuild homes and bring hope.
whyMatters: It's important to learn about what happens in other countries and to understand how we can all help each other when bad things happen, showing kindness and support.
